forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Clear. Low around 56, with temperatures rising to around 58 overnight. Northwest wind around 12 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph.

forecast.name: Monday
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 74, with temperatures falling to around 72 in the afternoon. North northwest wind 9 to 13 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph.

weather_report:
As night envelops Downtown San Francisco, the atmosphere remains crystal clear, with a gentle coolness settling in around 56 degrees. The Northwest wind carries a soft whisper, rustling through the trees and weaving its way between buildings. The vibrancy of the city lights reflects a calm serenity, hinting at the beauty of the night without the intrusion of fog or haze. 

Tomorrow promises to be sunlit and warm, nudging up to the mid-seventies before gracefully retreating to comfortable temperatures in the afternoon. Dress lightly yet warmly, perhaps opting for layers that can easily adapt to the day’s gentle fluctuations—think a light jacket over a t-shirt. This weather calls for activities that embrace the beauty of the outdoors, whether it's a leisurely stroll along the Embarcadero or a quaint café visit, savoring a warm drink while watching the world go by. There’s an undeniable charm in simply meandering through the city, allowing the pleasant air and favorable temperatures to enhance the experience of the evening.
